intro: Leucoglossum, commonly known as the white-lipped plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically feature white petals and yellow centers. The genus includes several species, such as Leucoglossum candidum, which is native to North America. These plants often thrive in moist, well-drained soils and are commonly found in prairie and wetland habitats. They play an important role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
